title: georgia for print?
content:
hey,

what you think of using the georgia font for print stuff?  
is it kinda nonprofessional because georgia was designed for screen?

if so - what alternative fonts you suggest?

thanks!  
file
author: file

comments.content: To me, it’s not as ￼<cite>terrible</cite> as to [others](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416170911/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36352?page=2). Still, it may feel a little bit uninspired and clumsy. Alternatives? I like [Excelsior](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416170911/http:/www.linotype.com/387/excelsior-family.html) a lot. Quite robust newspaper face, actually. And have a look what [MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416170911/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/microsoft/georgia/morelikethis.html) suggests … there are some fresh beauties among them.
Some say _Miller_ (font bureau) is a good replacement for fine print. Georgia does a good job, if you laser-print directly from a website – my opinion.

Miller by Matthew Carter, the designer of Georgia, has created to the most lovely scotch ever!  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416170911/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Miller "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Miller")

Then there is Vincent also by Matthew Carter- you have to ask Carter and Cone directly about pricing.  
 [www.carterandcone.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416170911/http:/www.carterandcone.com/ "www.carterandcone.com")

The new Chronicle is a very honed interpretation, although in my opinion not as pretty.  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100032](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416170911/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100032 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100032")

Lorena by Eduardo Manso will be coming out soon and it looks like it fits within the genre.  
 [http://www.emtype.net/proceso\_5.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416170911/http:/www.emtype.net/proceso_5.html "http://www.emtype.net/proceso\_5.html")

Also Scotch FB  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/ScotchFB](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416170911/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/ScotchFB "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/ScotchFB")

We had that topic once, "the guys around Mr. Carter" should do a Print-Georgia. But, would it be profitable, what do you think?

PS  
Or a Verdana-FinePrint with OSF and all that stuff – Verdana25ultralight.otf, hehe

great links & informations! i think the "miller" will do the job.  
thanks!
there is no delete post button... you have to edit your post and type just a period.
or just type "x2" and a moderator will come along and clean it up.
